intro: Pilosella filifera, commonly known as the filiform pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and its leaves are usually hairy and narrow. Pilosella filifera is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with minimal care.
